definition: to look upon/to take a fancy to/to fall for
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
it would appear/it seems (that)

sentences.english: They don't really look like white elephants.
sentences.chinese: 看上去并不真象一群白象。

sentences.english: It looks like the drums in Drum Tower in Xi'An.
sentences.chinese: 它看上去很像西安鼓楼里的鼓。

sentences.english: Despite the clouds, the Matterhorn still was a great piece of rock to look at.
sentences.chinese: 除了云朵外，马特宏峰看上去始终是块壮观的石头。

sentences.english: Sneaking out may seem like a real option in the heat of anger.
sentences.chinese: 盛怒之下，偷偷溜出去看上去似乎是真正的解决之道。

sentences.english: A broken wood bridge, looked like was damaged by the thunderstorm.
sentences.chinese: 一个断裂的木桥，看上去象是被暴风雨冲垮的。

sentences.english: The result is a universe that now looks like a sponge.
sentences.chinese: 结果是如今的宇宙看上去就像一块海绵。

sentences.english: Police say Chin appeared fine when guards brought breakfast to his cell.
sentences.chinese: 警方称陈在狱卒给他送早餐的时候看上去一切正常。

sentences.english: Oh，they look just like live cranes.
sentences.chinese: 哦，这些仙鹤看上去就像真的一样。

sentences.english: Can you imagine how much smarter this is going to make you look?
sentences.chinese: 能想像这会让你看上去比以前聪明了多少吗？

sentences.english: Pablo looked at him through his bleary eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去目光呆滞，茫然若失。

sentences.english: He looks quite normal but there's something about him that gives me the willies .
sentences.chinese: 他看上去很正常，但是他有某种特点使我感到害怕。

sentences.english: You get a lot of suspicious-looking people in this bar.
sentences.chinese: 你这个酒吧里有许多人看上去很可疑。

sentences.english: I found a serious bug in my add-on, and I really want to get the fix up there quickly.
sentences.chinese: 我的附加组件已经发布，用户看上去很喜欢。

sentences.english: Sammy: Look like you just make some wood squares from these boxes here.
sentences.chinese: 看上去你只是用了这些箱子上的木框。

definition: to have a preference for/to fancy/to choose after consideration/to settle on
to find to one's taste/to pick (after looking at)/Taiwan pr. [xiang4 zhong4]
to be moved/to be tempted
a glance/a quick look/a glimpse
to attach importance to sth/to value
to water at the mouth/to drool
recognition/to recognize
to fascinate/to strongly attract/to obsess/to infatuate/to captivate/to enchant
pleasing to the eye/nice to look at
a mistake/an oversight/an error of judgment
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
if it were not for/but for
no wonder!/so that's why!
lit. eyes and eyebrows come and go (idiom); to make eyes/to exchange flirting glances with sb
to think to oneself/to think/to assume
just as expected/told you so
